column4: Im trying to install java, ive tried sudo apt-get install -f, and sudo apt-get install sun-java5-bin, but niether work. heres apt output: http://pastebin.com/m497af469
when i try to install the bin it says no canidate version
sure thanks brb
fix broken packages doesnt appear to do anything
i have multiverse on
whats th terminal command for fixing the dependencies
sun-java5-jre: Depends: sun-java5-bin (= 1.5.0-13-0ubuntu1) but it is not installable or
why woudnt it be installable
aptitude why-not sun-java5-bin
tried, it says no canidate version
doesn't look like you have the latest package lists and/or don't have the multiverse repository enabled
synaptic says its enabled
try this. sudo sh -c "aptitude update; aptitude install sun-java5-jre"
let's have a look at your /etc/apt/sources.list -- use the !pastebin for that
http://pastebin.com/m32cae68a
does it look okay?
what does this return?  apt-cache policy sun-java5-bin
i can't find anything that might be the cause of the problem
hmm, run this command and inlcude it's output in a !paste.  sudo aptitude update
you should be able to get the powerpc port from sun's website
http://pastebin.com/pastebin.php
that appears blank but anyway, no need for that now, you need to manually install java
